duas.title: Allah is Enough for Us
duas.translation: Allah is enough for us and He is the Best Protector.
duas.hadith: Ibn 'Abbās (radiy Allahü 'anhuma) narrated: '[The above] was said by Ibrāhīm ('alayhis-salām) when he was thrown into the fire; and it was said by Muhammad when (the hypocrites) said, 'Your enemies have mobilised their forces against you, so fear them, but this only increased them in faith and they replied: 'Allah is enough for us and He is the Best Protector (3:173).' (Bukhārī 4563)

duas.title: Seeking Refuge From the Enemy's Evil
duas.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّا نَجْعَلُكَ فِي نُحُوْرِهِمْ ، وَنَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شُرُوْرِهِمْ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innā naj' aluka fi nuḥūrihim, wa na'ūdhu bika min shurūrihim.
duas.translation: O Allah, we make You our shield against them and we seek refuge in You from their evil.
duas.hadith: When the Messenger of Allah was apprehensive of [a group] of people, he would say: [the above]. (Abū Dāwūd 1537)

duas.title: When Meeting the Enemy
duas.translation: O Allah, You are my Supporter and my Helper.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] when meeting the enemy. (Tirmidhi)

duas.title: Pray for the Oppressed
duas.translation: O Allah, grant us victory over the disbelieving people.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] when praying for the oppressed. (Bukhari)

duas.title: Du'a for the Poor & Needy
duas.translation: O Allah, forgive the Muslim men and women.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] when praying for the poor and needy. (Tirmidhi)

duas.title: Du'a for Forgiveness & Ease
duas.translation: O Allah, forgive me and have mercy on me.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] for forgiveness and ease. (Muslim)

duas.title: Du'a for Firmness & Victory
duas.arabic: رَبَّنَا أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا وَثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا
duas.transliteration: Rabbana afrigh 'alaynā ṣabran wa thabbit aqdāmanā.
duas.translation: Our Lord, pour upon us patience and plant firmly our feet.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] for firmness and victory. (Bukhari)

duas.title: Surah al-Sajdah & Surah al-Mulk
duas.translation: Recite Surah al-Sajdah and Surah al-Mulk.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite [the above] before sleeping. (Tirmidhi)

duas.title: Ayat al-Kursi: Exclusive Protection
duas.translation: Recite Ayat al-Kursi for exclusive protection.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) said [the above] will protect you. (Bukhari)

duas.title: Last 2 ayahs of Surah al-Baqarah: Will Suffice You
duas.translation: Recite the last two ayahs of Surah al-Baqarah, they will suffice you.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) said [the above] will suffice you. (Bukhari)

duas.title: Ayat al-Kursi: The Greatest Protection
duas.translation: Recite Ayat al-Kursi for the greatest protection.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) said [the above] will protect you. (Muslim)

duas.title: Three Quls: To Suffice You in All Your Matters
duas.translation: Recite the last three surahs (Qul).
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) said [the above] will suffice you in all your matters. (Tirmidhi)

duas.title: Sayyid al-Istighfar: The Best Way of Seeking Forgiveness
duas.translation: Recite Sayyid al-Istighfar for seeking forgiveness.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) said [the above] is the best way of seeking forgiveness. (Bukhari)

duas.title: Protect Yourself from Anxiety, Laziness & Debt
duas.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī a'ūdhu bika minal-hammi wal-ḥazan.
duas.translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from anxiety, laziness, and debt.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to seek protection from [the above]. (Muslim)

duas.title: Renew Your Faith
duas.translation: Renew your faith by saying La ilaha illallah.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above]. (Muslim)

duas.title: Ask Allah for a Good Day
duas.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ هَذَا الْيَوْمِ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as'aluka khayra hādhā al-yawm.
duas.translation: O Allah, I ask You for the good of this day.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to ask for [the above]. (Muslim)

duas.title: Tasbih, Tahmid and Takbir
duas.translation: Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite [the above]. (Bukhari)

duas.title: Ayat al-Kursi: The Greatest Protection
duas.translation: Recite Ayat al-Kursi for the greatest protection.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) said [the above] will protect you. (Muslim)

duas.title: Three Quls: To Suffice You in All Your Matters
duas.translation: Recite the last three surahs (Qul).
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) said [the above] will suffice you in all your matters. (Tirmidhi)

duas.title: Sayyid al-Istighfar: The Best Way of Seeking Forgiveness
duas.translation: Recite Sayyid al-Istighfar for seeking forgiveness.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) said [the above] is the best way of seeking forgiveness. (Bukhari)

duas.title: Protect Yourself from Anxiety, Laziness & Debt
duas.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī a'ūdhu bika minal-hammi wal-ḥazan.
duas.translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from anxiety, laziness, and debt.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to seek protection from [the above]. (Muslim)

duas.title: Renew Your Faith
duas.translation: Renew your faith by saying La ilaha illallah.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above]. (Muslim)

duas.title: Ask Allah for a Good Day
duas.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ هَذَا الْيَوْمِ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as'aluka khayra hādhā al-yawm.
duas.translation: O Allah, I ask You for the good of this day.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to ask for [the above]. (Muslim)

duas.title: Tasbih, Tahmid and Takbir
duas.translation: Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite [the above]. (Bukhari)

duas.title: Dua After Salah
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma anta as-salām wa minka as-salām.
duas.translation: O Allah, You are Peace and from You comes peace.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] after completing the prayer. (Muslim)

duas.title: Dua After Salah
duas.translation: I seek Allah's forgiveness.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to seek forgiveness [the above] three times after completing the prayer. (Muslim)

duas.title: Dua After Salah
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma anta as-salām wa minka as-salām.
duas.translation: O Allah, You are Peace and from You comes peace.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] after completing the prayer. (Muslim)

duas.title: Dua After Salah
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma anta as-salām wa minka as-salām.
duas.translation: O Allah, You are Peace and from You comes peace.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] after completing the prayer. (Muslim)

duas.title: Dua After Salah
duas.translation: I seek Allah's forgiveness.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to seek forgiveness [the above] three times after completing the prayer. (Muslim)

duas.title: Dua After Salah
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma anta as-salām wa minka as-salām.
duas.translation: O Allah, You are Peace and from You comes peace.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] after completing the prayer. (Muslim)

duas.title: Ruqyah
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma anta as-salām wa minka as-salām.
duas.translation: O Allah, You are Peace and from You comes peace.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] after completing the prayer. (Muslim)

duas.title: Illness
duas.translation: I seek Allah's forgiveness.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to seek forgiveness [the above] three times after completing the prayer. (Muslim)

duas.title: Dua After Salah
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma anta as-salām wa minka as-salām.
duas.translation: O Allah, You are Peace and from You comes peace.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] after completing the prayer. (Muslim)

duas.title: Waking Up Dua
duas.translation: All praise is for Allah who gave us life.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] upon waking up. (Bukhari)

duas.title: Nightmares Dua
duas.translation: I seek refuge in the perfect words of Allah.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) taught [the above] for protection from nightmares. (Tirmidhi)

duas.title: Dua for Wearing Clothes
duas.translation: All praise is for Allah who clothed me.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] when wearing new clothes. (Abu Dawood)

duas.title: Dua for Wearing Clothes
duas.translation: All praise is for Allah who clothed me.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] when wearing new clothes. (Abu Dawood)

duas.title: Dua for Wearing Clothes
duas.translation: All praise is for Allah who clothed me.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] when wearing new clothes. (Abu Dawood)

duas.title: Entering Home Dua
duas.translation: In the name of Allah we enter.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] when entering his home. (Muslim)

duas.title: Hajj and Umrah Dua
duas.translation: Here I am, O Allah, here I am.
duas.hadith: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say [the above] during Hajj and Umrah. (Bukhari)
